key_points: Kyle Rittenhouse, 18, is on trial for the homicide of two individuals and wounding another during unrest in Kenosha, Wisconsin.
The incident occurred on the night of August 25, 2020, amid protests following the police shooting of Jacob Blake.
Rittenhouse is accused of killing Anthony M. Huber, 26, and Joseph Rosenbaum, 36, and wounding Gaige Grosskreutz, now 27.
Rittenhouse, from Antioch, Illinois, was depicted in social media as a supporter of "Blue Lives Matter" and then-President Donald Trump.
He was armed with a Smith & Wesson AR-15 style .223 rifle during the events.
The criminal complaint outlines Rosenbaum was unarmed and was shot after throwing a plastic bag at Rittenhouse and attempting to seize his gun.
Huber was shot by Rittenhouse after he approached him with a skateboard and appeared to reach for the gun.
Grosskreutz, who was holding a handgun, was shot in the right arm by Rittenhouse.
After the shootings, Rittenhouse walked toward police with his hands up but was not arrested until the following morning after turning himself in.
Rittenhouse testified he did not go to Kenosha to look for trouble.
